404static unsigned long
405mos_gem_bo_tile_size(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem, unsigned long size,
406 uint32_t *tiling_mode)
407{
408 unsigned long min_size, max_size;
409 unsigned long i;
410
411 if (*tiling_mode == I915_TILING_NONE)
412 return size;
413
414 /* 965+ just need multiples of page size for tiling */
415 return ROUND_UP_TO(size, 4096);
416
417}
418
419/*
420 * Round a given pitch up to the minimum required for X tiling on a
421 * given chip. We use 512 as the minimum to allow for a later tiling
422 * change.
423 */
424static unsigned long
425mos_gem_bo_tile_pitch(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem,
426 unsigned long pitch, uint32_t *tiling_mode)
427{
428 unsigned long tile_width;
429 unsigned long i;
430
431 /* If untiled, then just align it so that we can do rendering
432 * to it with the 3D engine.
433 */
434 if (*tiling_mode == I915_TILING_NONE)
435 return ALIGN(pitch, 64);
436
437 if (*tiling_mode == I915_TILING_X
438 || (IS_915(bufmgr_gem->pci_device)
439 && *tiling_mode == I915_TILING_Y))
440 tile_width = 512;
441 else
442 tile_width = 128;
443
444 /* 965 is flexible */
445 return ROUND_UP_TO(pitch, tile_width);
446}
447
448static struct mos_gem_bo_bucket *
449mos_gem_bo_bucket_for_size(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem,
450 unsigned long size)
451{
452 int i;
453
454 for (i = 0; i < bufmgr_gem->num_buckets; i++) {
455 struct mos_gem_bo_bucket *bucket =
456 &bufmgr_gem->cache_bucket[i];
457 if (bucket->size >= size) {
458 return bucket;
459 }
460 }
461
462 return nullptr;
463}
464
465static void
466mos_gem_dump_validation_list(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem)
467{
468 int i, j;
469
470 for (i = 0; i < bufmgr_gem->exec_count; i++) {
471 struct mos_linux_bo *bo = bufmgr_gem->exec_bos[i];
472 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
473
474 if (bo_gem->relocs == nullptr || bo_gem->softpin_target == nullptr) {
475 MOS_DBG("%2d: %d %s(%s)\n", i, bo_gem->gem_handle,
476 bo_gem->is_softpin ? "*" : "",
477 bo_gem->name);
478 continue;
479 }
480
481 for (j = 0; j < bo_gem->reloc_count; j++) {
482 struct mos_linux_bo *target_bo = bo_gem->reloc_target_info[j].bo;
483 struct mos_bo_gem *target_gem =
484 (struct mos_bo_gem *) target_bo;
485
486 MOS_DBG("%2d: %d %s(%s)@0x%08x %08x -> "
487 "%d (%s)@0x%08x %08x + 0x%08x\n",
488 i,
489 bo_gem->gem_handle,
490 bo_gem->is_softpin ? "*" : "",
491 bo_gem->name,
492 upper_32_bits(bo_gem->relocs[j].offset),
493 lower_32_bits(bo_gem->relocs[j].offset),
494 target_gem->gem_handle,
495 target_gem->name,
496 upper_32_bits(target_bo->offset64),
497 lower_32_bits(target_bo->offset64),
498 bo_gem->relocs[j].delta);
499 }
500
501 for (j = 0; j < bo_gem->softpin_target_count; j++) {
502 struct mos_linux_bo *target_bo = bo_gem->softpin_target[j].bo;
503 struct mos_bo_gem *target_gem =
504 (struct mos_bo_gem *) target_bo;
505 MOS_DBG("%2d: %d %s(%s) -> "
506 "%d *(%s)@0x%08x %08x\n",
507 i,
508 bo_gem->gem_handle,
509 bo_gem->is_softpin ? "*" : "",
510 bo_gem->name,
511 target_gem->gem_handle,
512 target_gem->name,
513 upper_32_bits(target_bo->offset64),
514 lower_32_bits(target_bo->offset64));
515 }
516 }
517}
518
519static inline void
520mos_gem_bo_reference(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
521{
522 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
523
524 atomic_inc(&bo_gem->refcount);
525}

535static void
536mos_add_validate_buffer(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
537{
538 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
539 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
540 int index;
541 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object *exec_objects;
542 struct mos_linux_bo **exec_bos;
543
544 if (bo_gem->validate_index != -1)
545 return;
546
547 /* Extend the array of validation entries as necessary. */
548 if (bufmgr_gem->exec_count == bufmgr_gem->exec_size) {
549 int new_size = bufmgr_gem->exec_size * 2;
550
551 if (new_size == 0)
552 new_size = ARRAY_INIT_SIZE;
553
554 exec_objects = (struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object *)realloc(bufmgr_gem->exec_objects,
555 sizeof(*bufmgr_gem->exec_objects) * new_size);
556 if (!exec_objects)
557 return;
558
559 bufmgr_gem->exec_objects = exec_objects;
560
561 exec_bos = (struct mos_linux_bo **)realloc(bufmgr_gem->exec_bos,
562 sizeof(*bufmgr_gem->exec_bos) * new_size);
563 if (!exec_bos)
564 return;
565
566 bufmgr_gem->exec_bos = exec_bos;
567 bufmgr_gem->exec_size = new_size;
568 }
569
570 index = bufmgr_gem->exec_count;
571 bo_gem->validate_index = index;
572 /* Fill in array entry */
573 bufmgr_gem->exec_objects[index].handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
574 bufmgr_gem->exec_objects[index].relocation_count = bo_gem->reloc_count;
575 bufmgr_gem->exec_objects[index].relocs_ptr = (uintptr_t) bo_gem->relocs;
576 bufmgr_gem->exec_objects[index].alignment = bo->align;
577 bufmgr_gem->exec_objects[index].offset = 0;
578 bufmgr_gem->exec_bos[index] = bo;
579 bufmgr_gem->exec_count++;
580}
581
582static void
583mos_add_validate_buffer2(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, int need_fence)
584{
585 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *)bo->bufmgr;
586 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)bo;
587 int index;
588 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec2_objects;
589 struct mos_linux_bo **exec_bos;
590 int flags = 0;
591
592 if (need_fence)
593 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_NEEDS_FENCE;
594 if (bo_gem->pad_to_size)
595 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_PAD_TO_SIZE;
596 if (bo_gem->use_48b_address_range)
597 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_SUPPORTS_48B_ADDRESS;
598 if (bo_gem->is_softpin)
599 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_PINNED;
600 if (bo_gem->exec_async)
601 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_ASYNC;
602 if (bo_gem->exec_capture)
603 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_CAPTURE;
604
605 if (bo_gem->validate_index != -1) {
606 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[bo_gem->validate_index].flags |= flags;
607 return;
608 }
609
610 /* Extend the array of validation entries as necessary. */
611 if (bufmgr_gem->exec_count == bufmgr_gem->exec_size) {
612 int new_size = bufmgr_gem->exec_size * 2;
613
614 if (new_size == 0)
615 new_size = ARRAY_INIT_SIZE;
616 exec2_objects = (struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *)
617 realloc(bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects,
618 sizeof(*bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects) * new_size);
619 if (!exec2_objects)
620 return;
621
622 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects = exec2_objects;
623
624 exec_bos = (struct mos_linux_bo **)realloc(bufmgr_gem->exec_bos,
625 sizeof(*bufmgr_gem->exec_bos) * new_size);
626 if (!exec_bos)
627 return;
628
629 bufmgr_gem->exec_bos = exec_bos;
630 bufmgr_gem->exec_size = new_size;
631 }
632
633 index = bufmgr_gem->exec_count;
634 bo_gem->validate_index = index;
635 /* Fill in array entry */
636 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
637 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].relocation_count = bo_gem->reloc_count;
638 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].relocs_ptr = (uintptr_t)bo_gem->relocs;
639 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].alignment = bo->align;
640 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].offset = bo_gem->is_softpin ?
641 bo->offset64 : 0;
642 bufmgr_gem->exec_bos[index] = bo;
643 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].flags = flags;
644 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].rsvd1 = 0;
645 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].pad_to_size = bo_gem->pad_to_size;
646 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].rsvd2 = 0;
647 bufmgr_gem->exec_count++;
648}
649
650static void
651mos_add_reloc_objects(struct mos_reloc_target reloc_target)
652{
653 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *)reloc_target.bo->bufmgr;
654 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)reloc_target.bo;
655 int index;
656 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec2_objects;
657 struct mos_linux_bo **exec_bos;
658
659 if (bo_gem->validate_index != -1) {
660 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[bo_gem->validate_index].flags |= reloc_target.flags;
661 return;
662 }
663
664 /* Extend the array of validation entries as necessary. */
665 if (bufmgr_gem->exec_count == bufmgr_gem->exec_size) {
666 int new_size = bufmgr_gem->exec_size * 2;
667
668 if (new_size == 0)
669 new_size = ARRAY_INIT_SIZE;
670 exec2_objects = (struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *)
671 realloc(bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects,
672 sizeof(*bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects) * new_size);
673 if (!exec2_objects)
674 {
675 MOS_DBG("realloc exec2_objects failed!\n");
676 return;
677 }
678
679 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects = exec2_objects;
680
681 exec_bos = (struct mos_linux_bo **)realloc(bufmgr_gem->exec_bos,
682 sizeof(*bufmgr_gem->exec_bos) * new_size);
683 if (!exec_bos)
684 {
685 MOS_DBG("realloc exec_bo failed!\n");
686 return;
687 }
688
689 bufmgr_gem->exec_bos = exec_bos;
690 bufmgr_gem->exec_size = new_size;
691 }
692
693 index = bufmgr_gem->exec_count;
694 bo_gem->validate_index = index;
695 /* Fill in array entry */
696 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
697 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].relocation_count = bo_gem->reloc_count;
698 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].relocs_ptr = (uintptr_t)bo_gem->relocs;
699 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].alignment = reloc_target.bo->align;
700 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].offset = 0;
701 bufmgr_gem->exec_bos[index] = reloc_target.bo;
702 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].flags = reloc_target.flags;
703 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].rsvd1 = 0;
704 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].pad_to_size = bo_gem->pad_to_size;
705 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].rsvd2 = 0;
706 bufmgr_gem->exec_count++;
707}

709static void
710mos_add_softpin_objects(struct mos_softpin_target softpin_target)
711{
712 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *)softpin_target.bo->bufmgr;
713 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)softpin_target.bo;
714 int index;
715 struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *exec2_objects;
716 struct mos_linux_bo **exec_bos;
717
718 if (bo_gem->validate_index != -1) {
719 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[bo_gem->validate_index].flags |= softpin_target.flags;
720 return;
721 }
722
723 /* Extend the array of validation entries as necessary. */
724 if (bufmgr_gem->exec_count == bufmgr_gem->exec_size) {
725 int new_size = bufmgr_gem->exec_size * 2;
726
727 if (new_size == 0)
728 new_size = ARRAY_INIT_SIZE;
729 exec2_objects = (struct drm_i915_gem_exec_object2 *)
730 realloc(bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects,
731 sizeof(*bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects) * new_size);
732 if (!exec2_objects)
733 {
734 MOS_DBG("realloc exec2_objects failed!\n");
735 return;
736 }
737
738 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects = exec2_objects;
739
740 exec_bos = (struct mos_linux_bo **)realloc(bufmgr_gem->exec_bos,
741 sizeof(*bufmgr_gem->exec_bos) * new_size);
742 if (!exec_bos)
743 {
744 MOS_DBG("realloc exec_bo failed!\n");
745 return;
746 }
747
748 bufmgr_gem->exec_bos = exec_bos;
749 bufmgr_gem->exec_size = new_size;
750 }
751
752 index = bufmgr_gem->exec_count;
753 bo_gem->validate_index = index;
754 /* Fill in array entry */
755 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
756 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].relocation_count = bo_gem->reloc_count;
757 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].relocs_ptr = (uintptr_t)bo_gem->relocs;
758 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].alignment = softpin_target.bo->align;
759 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].offset = softpin_target.bo->offset64;
760 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].flags = softpin_target.flags;
761 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].pad_to_size = bo_gem->pad_to_size;
762 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].rsvd1 = 0;
763 bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects[index].rsvd2 = 0;
764 bufmgr_gem->exec_bos[index] = softpin_target.bo;
765 bufmgr_gem->exec_count++;
766}
767
768#define RELOC_BUF_SIZE(x) ((I915_RELOC_HEADER + x * I915_RELOC0_STRIDE) * \
769 sizeof(uint32_t))
770
771static void
772mos_bo_gem_set_in_aperture_size(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem,
773 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem,
774 unsigned int alignment)
775{
776 unsigned int size;
777
778 assert(!bo_gem->used_as_reloc_target);
779
780 /* The older chipsets are far-less flexible in terms of tiling,
781 * and require tiled buffer to be size aligned in the aperture.
782 * This means that in the worst possible case we will need a hole
783 * twice as large as the object in order for it to fit into the
784 * aperture. Optimal packing is for wimps.
785 */
786 size = bo_gem->bo.size;
787
788 bo_gem->reloc_tree_size = size + alignment;
789}
790
791static int
792mos_setup_reloc_list(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
793{
794 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
795 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
796 unsigned int max_relocs = bufmgr_gem->max_relocs;
797
798 if (bo->size / 4 < max_relocs)
799 max_relocs = bo->size / 4;
800
801 bo_gem->relocs = (struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry *)malloc(max_relocs *
802 sizeof(struct drm_i915_gem_relocation_entry));
803 bo_gem->reloc_target_info = (struct mos_reloc_target *)malloc(max_relocs *
804 sizeof(struct mos_reloc_target));
805 if (bo_gem->relocs == nullptr || bo_gem->reloc_target_info == nullptr) {
806 bo_gem->has_error = true;
807
808 free (bo_gem->relocs);
809 bo_gem->relocs = nullptr;
810
811 free (bo_gem->reloc_target_info);
812 bo_gem->reloc_target_info = nullptr;
813
814 return 1;
815 }
816
817 return 0;
818}
819
820static int
821mos_gem_bo_busy(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
822{
823 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
824 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
825 struct drm_i915_gem_busy busy;
826 int ret;
827
828 if (bo_gem->reusable && bo_gem->idle)
829 return false;
830
831 memclear(busy);
832 busy.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
833
834 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_BUSY, &busy);
835 if (ret == 0) {
836 bo_gem->idle = !busy.busy;
837 return busy.busy;
838 } else {
839 return false;
840 }
841 return (ret == 0 && busy.busy);
842}
843
844static int
845mos_gem_bo_madvise_internal(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem,
846 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem, int state)
847{
848 struct drm_i915_gem_madvise madv;
849
850 memclear(madv);
851 madv.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
852 madv.madv = state;
853 madv.retained = 1;
854 drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_MADVISE, &madv);
855
856 return madv.retained;
857}
858
859static int
860mos_gem_bo_madvise(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, int madv)
861{
862 return mos_gem_bo_madvise_internal
863 ((struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr,
864 (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo,
865 madv);
866}
867
868/* drop the oldest entries that have been purged by the kernel */
869static void
870mos_gem_bo_cache_purge_bucket(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem,
871 struct mos_gem_bo_bucket *bucket)
872{
873 while (!DRMLISTEMPTY(&bucket->head)) {
874 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem;
875
876 bo_gem = DRMLISTENTRY(struct mos_bo_gem,
877 bucket->head.next, head);
878 if (mos_gem_bo_madvise_internal
879 (bufmgr_gem, bo_gem, I915_MADV_DONTNEED))
880 break;
881
882 DRMLISTDEL(&bo_gem->head);
883 mos_gem_bo_free(&bo_gem->bo);
884 }
885}
886
887static int
888mos_gem_query_items(int fd, struct drm_i915_query_item *items, uint32_t n_items)
889{
890 struct drm_i915_query q;
891
892 memclear(q);
893 q.num_items = n_items;
894 q.items_ptr = (uintptr_t)items;
895
896 return drmIoctl(fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_QUERY, &q);
897}
898
902static struct drm_i915_query_memory_regions *mos_gem_get_query_memory_regions(int fd)
903{
904 int ret;
905 struct drm_i915_query_item item;
906 struct drm_i915_query_memory_regions *query_info;
907
908 memclear(item);
909 item.query_id = DRM_I915_QUERY_MEMORY_REGIONS;
910 ret = mos_gem_query_items(fd, &item, 1);
911 if (ret != 0 || item.length <= 0)
912 return nullptr;
913
914 query_info = (drm_i915_query_memory_regions*)calloc(1, item.length);
915
916 item.data_ptr = (uintptr_t)query_info;
917 ret = mos_gem_query_items(fd, &item, 1);
918 if (ret != 0) {
919 free(query_info);
920 return nullptr;
921 }
922
923 return query_info;
924}
925
929static uint8_t mos_gem_get_lmem_region_count(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem)
930{
931 assert(nullptr != bufmgr_gem);
932
933 if (BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported()) {
934 return bufmgr_gem->prelim->GetLmemRegionCount();
935 }
936
937 struct drm_i915_query_memory_regions *query_info;
938 uint8_t num_regions = 0;
939 uint8_t lmem_regions = 0;
940
941 query_info = mos_gem_get_query_memory_regions(bufmgr_gem->fd);
942
943 if(nullptr != query_info)
944 {
945 num_regions = query_info->num_regions;
946
947 for (int i = 0; i < num_regions; i++) {
948 if (query_info->regions[i].region.memory_class == I915_MEMORY_CLASS_DEVICE)
949 {
950 lmem_regions += 1;
951 }
952 }
953 free(query_info);
954 }
955
956 return lmem_regions;
957}
958
962static bool mos_gem_has_lmem(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem)
963{
964 return mos_gem_get_lmem_region_count(bufmgr_gem) > 0;
965}
966
967static enum mos_memory_zone
968mos_gem_bo_memzone_for_address(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr, uint64_t address)
969{
970 assert(nullptr != bufmgr);
971 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *)bufmgr;
972
973 if (BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported()) {
974 return bufmgr_gem->prelim->GetMemzoneForAddress(address);
975 }
976 if (address >= MEMZONE_DEVICE_START)
977 return MEMZONE_DEVICE;
978 else
979 return MEMZONE_SYS;
980}
981
985static uint64_t
986mos_gem_bo_vma_alloc(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr,
987 enum mos_memory_zone memzone,
988 uint64_t size,
989 uint64_t alignment)
990{
991 CHK_CONDITION(bufmgr == nullptr, "nullptr bufmgr.\n", 0);
992 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bufmgr;
993 /* Force alignment to be some number of pages */
994 alignment = ALIGN(alignment, PAGE_SIZE);
995
996 uint64_t addr = mos_vma_heap_alloc(&bufmgr_gem->vma_heap[memzone], size, alignment);
997
998 // currently only support 48bit range address
999 CHK_CONDITION((addr >> 48ull) != 0, "invalid address, over 48bit range.\n", 0);
1000 CHK_CONDITION((addr >> (memzone == MEMZONE_SYS ? 40ull : (memzone == MEMZONE_DEVICE ? 41ull:42ull))) != 0, "invalid address, over memory zone range.\n", 0);
1001 CHK_CONDITION((addr % alignment) != 0, "invalid address, not meet aligment requirement.\n", 0);
1002
1003 return addr;
1004}
1005
1006static void
1007mos_gem_bo_vma_free(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr,
1008 uint64_t address,
1009 uint64_t size)
1010{
1011 CHK_CONDITION(bufmgr == nullptr, "nullptr bufmgr.\n", );
1012 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bufmgr;
1013
1014 CHK_CONDITION(address == 0ull, "invalid address.\n", );
1015 enum mos_memory_zone memzone = mos_gem_bo_memzone_for_address(bufmgr, address);
1016 mos_vma_heap_free(&bufmgr_gem->vma_heap[memzone], address, size);
1017}
1018
1019static int __mos_gem_create_gem(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem,
1020 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem,
1021 uint64_t bo_size)
1022{
1023 int ret = 0;
1024
1025 struct drm_i915_gem_memory_class_instance mem_region;
1026 memclear(mem_region);
1027 mem_region.memory_class = I915_MEMORY_CLASS_DEVICE;
1028 mem_region.memory_instance = 0;
1029
1030 struct drm_i915_gem_create_ext_memory_regions regions;
1031 memclear(regions);
1032 regions.base.name = I915_GEM_CREATE_EXT_MEMORY_REGIONS;
1033 regions.num_regions = 1;
1034 regions.regions = (uintptr_t)(&mem_region);
1035
1036 struct drm_i915_gem_create_ext create;
1037 memclear(create);
1038 create.size = bo_size;
1039 create.extensions = (uintptr_t)(&regions);
1040
1041 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1042 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_CREATE_EXT,
1043 &create);
1044 bo_gem->gem_handle = create.handle;
1045 bo_gem->bo.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1046 bo_gem->bo.size = create.size;
1047 bo_gem->mem_region = I915_MEMORY_CLASS_DEVICE;
1048
1049 return ret;
1050}
1051
1052drm_export struct mos_linux_bo *
1053mos_gem_bo_alloc_internal(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr,
1054 const char *name,
1055 unsigned long size,
1056 unsigned long flags,
1057 uint32_t tiling_mode,
1058 unsigned long stride,
1059 unsigned int alignment,
1060 int mem_type,
1061 unsigned int pat_index,
1062 bool cpu_cacheable)
1063{
1064 MOS_UNUSED(pat_index);
1065 MOS_UNUSED(cpu_cacheable);
1066 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bufmgr;
1067 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem;
1068 unsigned int page_size = getpagesize();
1069 int ret;
1070 struct mos_gem_bo_bucket *bucket;
1071 bool alloc_from_cache;
1072 unsigned long bo_size;
1073 bool for_render = false;
1074
1075 if (flags & BO_ALLOC_FOR_RENDER)
1076 for_render = true;
1077
1078 /* Round the allocated size up to a power of two number of pages. */
1079 bucket = mos_gem_bo_bucket_for_size(bufmgr_gem, size);
1080
1081 /* If we don't have caching at this size, don't actually round the
1082 * allocation up.
1083 */
1084 if (bucket == nullptr) {
1085 bo_size = size;
1086 if (bo_size < page_size)
1087 bo_size = page_size;
1088 } else {
1089 bo_size = bucket->size;
1090 }
1091
1092 pthread_mutex_lock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1093 /* Get a buffer out of the cache if available */
1094retry:
1095 alloc_from_cache = false;
1096 if (bucket != nullptr && !DRMLISTEMPTY(&bucket->head)) {
1097 if (for_render) {
1098 /* Allocate new render-target BOs from the tail (MRU)
1099 * of the list, as it will likely be hot in the GPU
1100 * cache and in the aperture for us.
1101 */
1102 bo_gem = DRMLISTENTRY(struct mos_bo_gem,
1103 bucket->head.prev, head);
1104 DRMLISTDEL(&bo_gem->head);
1105 alloc_from_cache = true;
1106 bo_gem->bo.align = alignment;
1107 } else {
1108 assert(alignment == 0);
1109 /* For non-render-target BOs (where we're probably
1110 * going to map it first thing in order to fill it
1111 * with data), check if the last BO in the cache is
1112 * unbusy, and only reuse in that case. Otherwise,
1113 * allocating a new buffer is probably faster than
1114 * waiting for the GPU to finish.
1115 */
1116 bo_gem = DRMLISTENTRY(struct mos_bo_gem,
1117 bucket->head.next, head);
1118 if (!mos_gem_bo_busy(&bo_gem->bo)) {
1119 alloc_from_cache = true;
1120 DRMLISTDEL(&bo_gem->head);
1121 }
1122 }
1123
1124 if (alloc_from_cache) {
1125 if (!mos_gem_bo_madvise_internal
1126 (bufmgr_gem, bo_gem, I915_MADV_WILLNEED)) {
1127 mos_gem_bo_free(&bo_gem->bo);
1128 mos_gem_bo_cache_purge_bucket(bufmgr_gem,
1129 bucket);
1130 goto retry;
1131 }
1132
1133 if (mos_gem_bo_set_tiling_internal(&bo_gem->bo,
1134 tiling_mode,
1135 stride)) {
1136 mos_gem_bo_free(&bo_gem->bo);
1137 goto retry;
1138 }
1139
1140 /* when re-cycle the gem_bo, need to keep the VA space is keeping consistent on memory type
1141 i915 cannot switch same VA b/w system/Local
1142 */
1143 if (bufmgr_gem->has_lmem && mos_gem_bo_check_mem_region_internal(&bo_gem->bo, mem_type)) {
1144 mos_gem_bo_free(&bo_gem->bo);
1145 goto retry;
1146 }
1147 }
1148 }
1149 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1150
1151 if (!alloc_from_cache) {
1152
1153 bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)calloc(1, sizeof(*bo_gem));
1154 if (!bo_gem)
1155 return nullptr;
1156
1157 bo_gem->bo.size = bo_size;
1158 bo_gem->mem_region = BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported() ?
1159 bufmgr_gem->prelim->GetSystemMemRegionId() :
1160 I915_MEMORY_CLASS_SYSTEM;
1161
1162 if(bufmgr_gem->has_lmem &&
1163 (mem_type == MOS_MEMPOOL_VIDEOMEMORY || mem_type == MOS_MEMPOOL_DEVICEMEMORY)) {
1164 if (BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported()) {
1165 uint32_t handle;
1166 uint64_t size;
1167 uint32_t region;
1168 ret = bufmgr_gem->prelim->CreateGem(bo_size, handle, size, region);
1169 if (ret == 0) {
1170 bo_gem->gem_handle = handle;
1171 bo_gem->bo.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1172 bo_gem->bo.size = size;
1173 bo_gem->mem_region = region;
1174 }
1175 } else {
1176 ret = __mos_gem_create_gem(bufmgr_gem, bo_gem, bo_size);
1177 }
1178 }
1179 else {
1180 struct drm_i915_gem_create create;
1181 memclear(create);
1182 create.size = bo_size;
1183 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1184 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_CREATE,
1185 &create);
1186 bo_gem->gem_handle = create.handle;
1187 bo_gem->bo.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1188 }
1189 if (ret != 0) {
1190 free(bo_gem);
1191 return nullptr;
1192 }
1193 bo_gem->bo.bufmgr = bufmgr;
1194 bo_gem->bo.align = alignment;
1195
1196 bo_gem->tiling_mode = I915_TILING_NONE;
1197 bo_gem->swizzle_mode = I915_BIT_6_SWIZZLE_NONE;
1198 bo_gem->stride = 0;
1199 if (bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_fd != -1)
1200 {
1201 snprintf(bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_buffer, MEM_PROFILER_BUFFER_SIZE, "GEM_CREATE, %d, %d, %lu, %d, %s\n", getpid(), bo_gem->bo.handle, bo_gem->bo.size,bo_gem->mem_region, name);
1202 ret = write(bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_fd, bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_buffer, strnlen(bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_buffer, MEM_PROFILER_BUFFER_SIZE));
1203 if (ret == -1)
1204 {
1205 MOS_DBG("Failed to write to %s: %s\n", bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_path, strerror(errno));
1206 }
1207 }
1208
1209 /* drm_intel_gem_bo_free calls DRMLISTDEL() for an uninitialized
1210 list (vma_list), so better set the list head here */
1211 DRMINITLISTHEAD(&bo_gem->name_list);
1212 if (mos_gem_bo_set_tiling_internal(&bo_gem->bo,
1213 tiling_mode,
1214 stride)) {
1215 mos_gem_bo_free(&bo_gem->bo);
1216 return nullptr;
1217 }
1218 }
1219
1220 bo_gem->name = name;
1221 atomic_set(&bo_gem->refcount, 1);
1222 bo_gem->validate_index = -1;
1223 bo_gem->reloc_tree_fences = 0;
1224 bo_gem->used_as_reloc_target = false;
1225 bo_gem->has_error = false;
1226 bo_gem->reusable = true;
1227 bo_gem->use_48b_address_range = bufmgr_gem->bufmgr.bo_use_48b_address_range ? true : false;
1228
1229 mos_bo_gem_set_in_aperture_size(bufmgr_gem, bo_gem, alignment);
1230
1231 if (bufmgr_gem->use_softpin)
1232 {
1233 mos_bo_set_softpin(&bo_gem->bo);
1234 }
1235
1236 MOS_DBG("bo_create: buf %d (%s) %ldb\n",
1237 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name, size);
1238
1239 return &bo_gem->bo;
1240}
1241
1242static struct mos_linux_bo *
1243mos_gem_bo_alloc_for_render(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr,
1244 const char *name,
1245 unsigned long size,
1246 unsigned int alignment,
1247 int mem_type,
1248 unsigned int pat_index,
1249 bool cpu_cacheable)
1250{
1251 return mos_gem_bo_alloc_internal(bufmgr, name, size,
1252 I915_TILING_NONE, 0,
1253 BO_ALLOC_FOR_RENDER,
1254 alignment, mem_type, pat_index, cpu_cacheable);
1255}
1256
1257static struct mos_linux_bo *
1258mos_gem_bo_alloc(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr,
1259 const char *name,
1260 unsigned long size,
1261 unsigned int alignment,
1262 int mem_type,
1263 unsigned int pat_index,
1264 bool cpu_cacheable)
1265{
1266 return mos_gem_bo_alloc_internal(bufmgr, name, size, 0,
1267 I915_TILING_NONE, 0, 0, mem_type, pat_index, cpu_cacheable);
1268}
1269
1270static struct mos_linux_bo *
1271mos_gem_bo_alloc_tiled(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr, const char *name,
1272 int x, int y, int cpp, uint32_t *tiling_mode,
1273 unsigned long *pitch, unsigned long flags,
1274 int mem_type, unsigned int pat_index, bool cpu_cacheable)
1275{
1276 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *)bufmgr;
1277 unsigned long size, stride;
1278 uint32_t tiling;
1279
1280 do {
1281 unsigned long aligned_y, height_alignment;
1282
1283 tiling = *tiling_mode;
1284
1285 /* If we're tiled, our allocations are in 8 or 32-row blocks,
1286 * so failure to align our height means that we won't allocate
1287 * enough pages.
1288 *
1289 * If we're untiled, we still have to align to 2 rows high
1290 * because the data port accesses 2x2 blocks even if the
1291 * bottom row isn't to be rendered, so failure to align means
1292 * we could walk off the end of the GTT and fault. This is
1293 * documented on 965, and may be the case on older chipsets
1294 * too so we try to be careful.
1295 */
1296 aligned_y = y;
1297 height_alignment = 2;
1298
1299 if (tiling == I915_TILING_X
1300 || (IS_915(bufmgr_gem->pci_device)
1301 && tiling == I915_TILING_Y))
1302 height_alignment = 8;
1303 else if (tiling == I915_TILING_Y)
1304 height_alignment = 32;
1305 aligned_y = ALIGN(y, height_alignment);
1306
1307 stride = x * cpp;
1308 stride = mos_gem_bo_tile_pitch(bufmgr_gem, stride, tiling_mode);
1309 size = stride * aligned_y;
1310 size = mos_gem_bo_tile_size(bufmgr_gem, size, tiling_mode);
1311 } while (*tiling_mode != tiling);
1312 *pitch = stride;
1313
1314 if (tiling == I915_TILING_NONE)
1315 stride = 0;
1316
1317 return mos_gem_bo_alloc_internal(bufmgr, name, size, flags,
1318 tiling, stride, 0, mem_type, pat_index, cpu_cacheable);
1319}
1320
1321static struct mos_linux_bo *
1322mos_gem_bo_alloc_userptr(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr,
1323 const char *name,
1324 void *addr,
1325 uint32_t tiling_mode,
1326 uint32_t stride,
1327 unsigned long size,
1328 unsigned long flags)
1329{
1330 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bufmgr;
1331 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem;
1332 int ret;
1333 struct drm_i915_gem_userptr userptr;
1334
1335 /* Tiling with userptr surfaces is not supported
1336 * on all hardware so refuse it for time being.
1337 */
1338 if (tiling_mode != I915_TILING_NONE)
1339 return nullptr;
1340
1341 bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)calloc(1, sizeof(*bo_gem));
1342 if (!bo_gem)
1343 return nullptr;
1344
1345 bo_gem->bo.size = size;
1346
1347 memclear(userptr);
1348 userptr.user_ptr = (__u64)((unsigned long)addr);
1349 userptr.user_size = size;
1350 userptr.flags = 0;
1351
1352 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1353 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_USERPTR,
1354 &userptr);
1355 if (ret != 0) {
1356 MOS_DBG("bo_create_userptr: "
1357 "ioctl failed with user ptr %p size 0x%lx, "
1358 "user flags 0x%lx\n", addr, size, flags);
1359 free(bo_gem);
1360 return nullptr;
1361 }
1362
1363 bo_gem->gem_handle = userptr.handle;
1364 bo_gem->bo.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1365 bo_gem->bo.bufmgr = bufmgr;
1366 bo_gem->is_userptr = true;
1367#ifdef __cplusplus
1368 bo_gem->bo.virt = addr;
1369#else
1370 bo_gem->bo.virtual = addr;
1371#endif
1372 /* Save the address provided by user */
1373 bo_gem->user_virtual = addr;
1374 bo_gem->tiling_mode = I915_TILING_NONE;
1375 bo_gem->swizzle_mode = I915_BIT_6_SWIZZLE_NONE;
1376 bo_gem->stride = 0;
1377
1378 DRMINITLISTHEAD(&bo_gem->name_list);
1379
1380 bo_gem->name = name;
1381 atomic_set(&bo_gem->refcount, 1);
1382 bo_gem->validate_index = -1;
1383 bo_gem->reloc_tree_fences = 0;
1384 bo_gem->used_as_reloc_target = false;
1385 bo_gem->has_error = false;
1386 bo_gem->reusable = false;
1387 bo_gem->use_48b_address_range = bufmgr_gem->bufmgr.bo_use_48b_address_range ? true : false;
1388
1389 mos_bo_gem_set_in_aperture_size(bufmgr_gem, bo_gem, 0);
1390
1391 if (bufmgr_gem->use_softpin)
1392 {
1393 mos_bo_set_softpin(&bo_gem->bo);
1394 }
1395
1396 MOS_DBG("bo_create_userptr: "
1397 "ptr %p buf %d (%s) size %ldb, stride 0x%x, tile mode %d\n",
1398 addr, bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name,
1399 size, stride, tiling_mode);
1400
1401 return &bo_gem->bo;
1402}
1403
1404static bool
1405has_userptr(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem)
1406{
1407 int ret;
1408 void *ptr;
1409 long pgsz;
1410 struct drm_i915_gem_userptr userptr;
1411
1412 pgsz = sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE);
1413 assert(pgsz > 0);
1414
1415 ret = posix_memalign(&ptr, pgsz, pgsz);
1416 if (ret) {
1417 MOS_DBG("Failed to get a page (%ld) for userptr detection!\n",
1418 pgsz);
1419 return false;
1420 }
1421
1422 memclear(userptr);
1423 userptr.user_ptr = (__u64)(unsigned long)ptr;
1424 userptr.user_size = pgsz;
1425
1426retry:
1427 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_USERPTR, &userptr);
1428 if (ret) {
1429 if (errno == ENODEV && userptr.flags == 0) {
1430 userptr.flags = I915_USERPTR_UNSYNCHRONIZED;
1431 goto retry;
1432 }
1433 free(ptr);
1434 return false;
1435 }
1436
1437 /* We don't release the userptr bo here as we want to keep the
1438 * kernel mm tracking alive for our lifetime. The first time we
1439 * create a userptr object the kernel has to install a mmu_notifer
1440 * which is a heavyweight operation (e.g. it requires taking all
1441 * mm_locks and stop_machine()).
1442 */
1443
1444 bufmgr_gem->userptr_active.ptr = ptr;
1445 bufmgr_gem->userptr_active.handle = userptr.handle;
1446 return true;
1447}
1448
1449static struct mos_linux_bo *
1450check_bo_alloc_userptr(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr,
1451 const char *name,
1452 void *addr,
1453 uint32_t tiling_mode,
1454 uint32_t stride,
1455 unsigned long size,
1456 unsigned long flags)
1457{
1458 if (has_userptr((struct mos_bufmgr_gem *)bufmgr))
1459 bufmgr->bo_alloc_userptr = mos_gem_bo_alloc_userptr;
1460 else
1461 bufmgr->bo_alloc_userptr = nullptr;
1462
1463 return mos_bo_alloc_userptr(bufmgr, name, addr,
1464 tiling_mode, stride, size, flags);
1465}
1466
1473static struct mos_linux_bo *
1474mos_bufmgr_bo_gem_create_from_name(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr,
1475 const char *name,
1476 unsigned int handle)
1477{
1478 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bufmgr;
1479 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem;
1480 int ret;
1481 struct drm_gem_open open_arg;
1482 struct drm_i915_gem_get_tiling get_tiling;
1483 drmMMListHead *list;
1484
1485 /* At the moment most applications only have a few named bo.
1486 * For instance, in a DRI client only the render buffers passed
1487 * between X and the client are named. And since X returns the
1488 * alternating names for the front/back buffer a linear search
1489 * provides a sufficiently fast match.
1490 */
1491 pthread_mutex_lock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1492 for (list = bufmgr_gem->named.next;
1493 list != &bufmgr_gem->named;
1494 list = list->next) {
1495 bo_gem = DRMLISTENTRY(struct mos_bo_gem, list, name_list);
1496 if (bo_gem->global_name == handle) {
1497 mos_gem_bo_reference(&bo_gem->bo);
1498 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1499 return &bo_gem->bo;
1500 }
1501 }
1502
1503 memclear(open_arg);
1504 open_arg.name = handle;
1505 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1506 DRM_IOCTL_GEM_OPEN,
1507 &open_arg);
1508 if (ret != 0) {
1509 MOS_DBG("Couldn't reference %s handle 0x%08x: %s\n",
1510 name, handle, strerror(errno));
1511 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1512 return nullptr;
1513 }
1514 /* Now see if someone has used a prime handle to get this
1515 * object from the kernel before by looking through the list
1516 * again for a matching gem_handle
1517 */
1518 for (list = bufmgr_gem->named.next;
1519 list != &bufmgr_gem->named;
1520 list = list->next) {
1521 bo_gem = DRMLISTENTRY(struct mos_bo_gem, list, name_list);
1522 if (bo_gem->gem_handle == open_arg.handle) {
1523 mos_gem_bo_reference(&bo_gem->bo);
1524 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1525 return &bo_gem->bo;
1526 }
1527 }
1528
1529 bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)calloc(1, sizeof(*bo_gem));
1530 if (!bo_gem) {
1531 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1532 return nullptr;
1533 }
1534
1535 bo_gem->bo.size = open_arg.size;
1536 bo_gem->bo.offset = 0;
1537 bo_gem->bo.offset64 = 0;
1538#if defined(__cplusplus)
1539 bo_gem->bo.virt = nullptr;
1540#else
1541 bo_gem->bo.virtual = nullptr;
1542#endif
1543 bo_gem->bo.bufmgr = bufmgr;
1544 bo_gem->name = name;
1545 atomic_set(&bo_gem->refcount, 1);
1546 bo_gem->validate_index = -1;
1547 bo_gem->gem_handle = open_arg.handle;
1548 bo_gem->bo.handle = open_arg.handle;
1549 bo_gem->global_name = handle;
1550 bo_gem->reusable = false;
1551 bo_gem->use_48b_address_range = bufmgr_gem->bufmgr.bo_use_48b_address_range ? true : false;
1552
1553 memclear(get_tiling);
1554 if (bufmgr_gem->has_fence_reg) {
1555 get_tiling.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1556 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1557 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_GET_TILING,
1558 &get_tiling);
1559 if (ret != 0) {
1560 mos_gem_bo_unreference(&bo_gem->bo);
1561 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1562 return nullptr;
1563 }
1564 }
1565 bo_gem->tiling_mode = get_tiling.tiling_mode;
1566 bo_gem->swizzle_mode = get_tiling.swizzle_mode;
1567 /* XXX stride is unknown */
1568
1569 mos_bo_gem_set_in_aperture_size(bufmgr_gem, bo_gem, 0);
1570
1571 DRMLISTADDTAIL(&bo_gem->name_list, &bufmgr_gem->named);
1572 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1573
1574 if (bufmgr_gem->use_softpin)
1575 {
1576 mos_bo_set_softpin(&bo_gem->bo);
1577 }
1578
1579 MOS_DBG("bo_create_from_handle: %d (%s)\n", handle, bo_gem->name);
1580
1581 return &bo_gem->bo;
1582}
1583
1584static void
1585mos_gem_bo_free(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
1586{
1587 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = nullptr;
1588 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
1589 struct drm_gem_close close;
1590 int ret;
1591
1592 CHK_CONDITION(bo_gem == nullptr, "bo_gem == nullptr\n", );
1593
1594 bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
1595
1596 CHK_CONDITION(bufmgr_gem == nullptr, "bufmgr_gem == nullptr\n", );
1597
1598 if (bo_gem->mem_virtual) {
1599 VG(VALGRIND_FREELIKE_BLOCK(bo_gem->mem_virtual, 0));
1600 drm_munmap(bo_gem->mem_virtual, bo_gem->bo.size);
1601 }
1602 if (bo_gem->gtt_virtual) {
1603 drm_munmap(bo_gem->gtt_virtual, bo_gem->bo.size);
1604 }
1605 if (bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual) {
1606 VG(VALGRIND_FREELIKE_BLOCK(bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual, 0));
1607 drm_munmap(bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual, bo_gem->bo.size);
1608 }
1609
1610 if(bufmgr_gem->bufmgr.bo_wait_rendering && mos_gem_bo_busy(bo))
1611 {
1612 bufmgr_gem->bufmgr.bo_wait_rendering(bo);
1613 }
1614
1615 /* Close this object */
1616 memclear(close);
1617 close.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1618 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_GEM_CLOSE, &close);
1619 if (ret != 0) {
1620 MOS_DBG("DRM_IOCTL_GEM_CLOSE %d failed (%s): %s\n",
1621 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name, strerror(errno));
1622 }
1623 if (bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_fd != -1)
1624 {
1625 snprintf(bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_buffer, MEM_PROFILER_BUFFER_SIZE, "GEM_CLOSE, %d, %d, %lu, %d\n", getpid(), bo->handle,bo->size,bo_gem->mem_region);
1626 ret = write(bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_fd, bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_buffer, strnlen(bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_buffer, MEM_PROFILER_BUFFER_SIZE));
1627 if (ret == -1)
1628 {
1629 MOS_DBG("Failed to write to %s: %s\n", bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_path, strerror(errno));
1630 }
1631 }
1632
1633 if (bufmgr_gem->use_softpin)
1634 {
1635 /* Return the VMA for reuse */
1636 mos_gem_bo_vma_free(bo->bufmgr, bo->offset64, bo->size);
1637 }
1638
1639 free(bo);
1640}
1641
1642static void
1643mos_gem_bo_mark_mmaps_incoherent(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
1644{
1645#if HAVE_VALGRIND
1646 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
1647
1648 if (bo_gem->mem_virtual)
1649 VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_NOACCESS(bo_gem->mem_virtual, bo->size);
1650
1651 if (bo_gem->gtt_virtual)
1652 VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_NOACCESS(bo_gem->gtt_virtual, bo->size);
1653
1654 if (bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual)
1655 VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_NOACCESS(bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual, bo->size);
1656#endif
1657}
1658
1660static void
1661mos_gem_cleanup_bo_cache(struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem, time_t time)
1662{
1663 int i;
1664
1665 if (bufmgr_gem->time == time)
1666 return;
1667
1668 for (i = 0; i < bufmgr_gem->num_buckets; i++) {
1669 struct mos_gem_bo_bucket *bucket =
1670 &bufmgr_gem->cache_bucket[i];
1671
1672 while (!DRMLISTEMPTY(&bucket->head)) {
1673 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem;
1674
1675 bo_gem = DRMLISTENTRY(struct mos_bo_gem,
1676 bucket->head.next, head);
1677 if (time - bo_gem->free_time <= 1)
1678 break;
1679
1680 DRMLISTDEL(&bo_gem->head);
1681
1682 mos_gem_bo_free(&bo_gem->bo);
1683 }
1684 }
1685
1686 bufmgr_gem->time = time;
1687}
1688
1689drm_export void
1690mos_gem_bo_unreference_final(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, time_t time)
1691{
1692 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
1693 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
1694 struct mos_gem_bo_bucket *bucket;
1695 int i;
1696
1697 /* Unreference all the target buffers */
1698 for (i = 0; i < bo_gem->reloc_count; i++) {
1699 if (bo_gem->reloc_target_info[i].bo != bo) {
1700 mos_gem_bo_unreference_locked_timed(bo_gem->
1701 reloc_target_info[i].bo,
1702 time);
1703 }
1704 }
1705 for (i = 0; i < bo_gem->softpin_target_count; i++)
1706 mos_gem_bo_unreference_locked_timed(bo_gem->softpin_target[i].bo,
1707 time);
1708 bo_gem->reloc_count = 0;
1709 bo_gem->used_as_reloc_target = false;
1710 bo_gem->softpin_target_count = 0;
1711 bo_gem->exec_async = false;
1712
1713 MOS_DBG("bo_unreference final: %d (%s)\n",
1714 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name);
1715 bo_gem->pad_to_size = 0;
1716
1717 /* release memory associated with this object */
1718 if (bo_gem->reloc_target_info) {
1719 free(bo_gem->reloc_target_info);
1720 bo_gem->reloc_target_info = nullptr;
1721 }
1722 if (bo_gem->relocs) {
1723 free(bo_gem->relocs);
1724 bo_gem->relocs = nullptr;
1725 }
1726 if (bo_gem->softpin_target) {
1727 free(bo_gem->softpin_target);
1728 bo_gem->softpin_target = nullptr;
1729 bo_gem->max_softpin_target_count = 0;
1730 }
1731
1732 /* Clear any left-over mappings */
1733 if (bo_gem->map_count) {
1734 MOS_DBG("bo freed with non-zero map-count %d\n", bo_gem->map_count);
1735 bo_gem->map_count = 0;
1736 mos_gem_bo_mark_mmaps_incoherent(bo);
1737 }
1738
1739 DRMLISTDEL(&bo_gem->name_list);
1740
1741 bucket = mos_gem_bo_bucket_for_size(bufmgr_gem, bo->size);
1742 /* Put the buffer into our internal cache for reuse if we can. */
1743 if (bufmgr_gem->bo_reuse && bo_gem->reusable && bucket != nullptr &&
1744 mos_gem_bo_madvise_internal(bufmgr_gem, bo_gem,
1745 I915_MADV_DONTNEED)) {
1746 bo_gem->free_time = time;
1747
1748 bo_gem->name = nullptr;
1749 bo_gem->validate_index = -1;
1750
1751 DRMLISTADDTAIL(&bo_gem->head, &bucket->head);
1752 } else {
1753 mos_gem_bo_free(bo);
1754 }
1755}
1756
1757static void mos_gem_bo_unreference_locked_timed(struct mos_linux_bo *bo,
1758 time_t time)
1759{
1760 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
1761
1762 assert(atomic_read(&bo_gem->refcount) > 0);
1763 if (atomic_dec_and_test(&bo_gem->refcount))
1764 mos_gem_bo_unreference_final(bo, time);
1765}
1766
1767static void mos_gem_bo_unreference(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
1768{
1769 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
1770
1771 assert(atomic_read(&bo_gem->refcount) > 0);
1772
1773 if (atomic_add_unless(&bo_gem->refcount, -1, 1)) {
1774 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem =
1775 (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
1776 struct timespec time;
1777
1778 clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &time);
1779
1780 pthread_mutex_lock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1781
1782 if (atomic_dec_and_test(&bo_gem->refcount)) {
1783 mos_gem_bo_unreference_final(bo, time.tv_sec);
1784 mos_gem_cleanup_bo_cache(bufmgr_gem, time.tv_sec);
1785 }
1786
1787 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1788 }
1789}
1790
1791static int
1792map_wc(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
1793{
1794 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
1795 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
1796 int ret;
1797
1798 if (bo_gem->is_userptr)
1799 return -EINVAL;
1800
1801 if (!bufmgr_gem->has_ext_mmap)
1802 return -EINVAL;
1803
1804 /* Get a mapping of the buffer if we haven't before. */
1805 if (bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual == nullptr && bufmgr_gem->has_mmap_offset) {
1806 struct drm_i915_gem_mmap_offset mmap_arg;
1807
1808 MOS_DBG("bo_map_wc: mmap_offset %d (%s), map_count=%d\n",
1809 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name, bo_gem->map_count);
1810
1811 memclear(mmap_arg);
1812 mmap_arg.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1813 /* To indicate the uncached virtual mapping to KMD */
1814 if (BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported()) {
1815 bufmgr_gem->prelim->SetMmapOffset(bo_gem->mem_region, mmap_arg);
1816 } else if (bufmgr_gem->has_lmem) {
1817 mmap_arg.flags = I915_MMAP_OFFSET_FIXED;
1818 }
1819 else
1820 {
1821 mmap_arg.flags = I915_MMAP_OFFSET_WC;
1822 }
1823 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1824 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_MMAP_OFFSET,
1825 &mmap_arg);
1826 if (ret != 0) {
1827 ret = -errno;
1828 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error mapping buffer %d (%s): %s .\n",
1829 __FILE__, __LINE__, bo_gem->gem_handle,
1830 bo_gem->name, strerror(errno));
1831 return ret;
1832 }
1833
1834 /* and mmap it */
1835 bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual = drm_mmap(0, bo->size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE,
1836 MAP_SHARED, bufmgr_gem->fd,
1837 mmap_arg.offset);
1838 if (bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual == MAP_FAILED) {
1839 bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual = nullptr;
1840 ret = -errno;
1841 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error mapping buffer %d (%s): %s .\n",
1842 __FILE__, __LINE__,
1843 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name,
1844 strerror(errno));
1845 }
1846 }
1847 else if (bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual == nullptr) {
1848 struct drm_i915_gem_mmap mmap_arg;
1849
1850 MOS_DBG("bo_map_wc: mmap %d (%s), map_count=%d\n",
1851 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name, bo_gem->map_count);
1852
1853 memclear(mmap_arg);
1854 mmap_arg.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1855 /* To indicate the uncached virtual mapping to KMD */
1856 mmap_arg.flags = I915_MMAP_WC;
1857 mmap_arg.size = bo->size;
1858 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1859 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_MMAP,
1860 &mmap_arg);
1861 if (ret != 0) {
1862 ret = -errno;
1863 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error mapping buffer %d (%s): %s .\n",
1864 __FILE__, __LINE__, bo_gem->gem_handle,
1865 bo_gem->name, strerror(errno));
1866 return ret;
1867 }
1868 VG(VALGRIND_MALLOCLIKE_BLOCK(mmap_arg.addr_ptr, mmap_arg.size, 0, 1));
1869 bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual = (void *)(uintptr_t) mmap_arg.addr_ptr;
1870 }
1871#ifdef __cplusplus
1872 bo->virt = bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual;
1873#else
1874 bo->virtual = bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual;
1875#endif
1876
1877 MOS_DBG("bo_map_wc: %d (%s) -> %p\n", bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name,
1878 bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual);
1879
1880 return 0;
1881}
1882
1883/* To be used in a similar way to mmap_gtt */
1884drm_export int
1885mos_gem_bo_map_wc(struct mos_linux_bo *bo) {
1886 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
1887 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
1888 struct drm_i915_gem_set_domain set_domain;
1889 struct drm_i915_gem_wait wait;
1890 int ret;
1891
1892 pthread_mutex_lock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1893
1894 ret = map_wc(bo);
1895 if (ret) {
1896 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1897 return ret;
1898 }
1899
1900 if (bufmgr_gem->has_lmem) {
1901 assert(bufmgr_gem->has_wait_timeout);
1902 memclear(wait);
1903 wait.bo_handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1904 wait.timeout_ns = -1; // infinite wait
1905 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT, &wait);
1906 if (ret == -1) {
1907 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT failed (%d)\n",
1908 __FILE__, __LINE__, errno);
1909 }
1910 } else {
1911 /* Now move it to the GTT domain so that the GPU and CPU
1912 * caches are flushed and the GPU isn't actively using the
1913 * buffer.
1914 *
1915 * The domain change is done even for the objects which
1916 * are not bounded. For them first the pages are acquired,
1917 * before the domain change.
1918 */
1919 memclear(set_domain);
1920 set_domain.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1921 set_domain.read_domains = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT;
1922 set_domain.write_domain = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT;
1923 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1924 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_SET_DOMAIN,
1925 &set_domain);
1926 if (ret != 0) {
1927 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error setting domain %d: %s\n",
1928 __FILE__, __LINE__, bo_gem->gem_handle,
1929 strerror(errno));
1930 }
1931 }
1932
1933 mos_gem_bo_mark_mmaps_incoherent(bo);
1934 VG(VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_DEFINED(bo_gem->mem_wc_virtual, bo->size));
1935 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1936
1937 return 0;
1938}
1939
1940drm_export int mos_gem_bo_map(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, int write_enable)
1941{
1942 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
1943 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
1944 int ret;
1945
1946 if (bo_gem->is_userptr) {
1947 /* Return the same user ptr */
1948#ifdef __cplusplus
1949 bo->virt = bo_gem->user_virtual;
1950#else
1951 bo->virtual = bo_gem->user_virtual;
1952#endif
1953 return 0;
1954 }
1955
1956 pthread_mutex_lock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1957
1958 if (bufmgr_gem->has_mmap_offset) {
1959 struct drm_i915_gem_wait wait;
1960
1961 if (!bo_gem->mem_virtual) {
1962 struct drm_i915_gem_mmap_offset mmap_arg;
1963
1964 MOS_DBG("bo_map: %d (%s), map_count=%d\n",
1965 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name, bo_gem->map_count);
1966
1967 memclear(mmap_arg);
1968 mmap_arg.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
1969 if (BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported()) {
1970 bufmgr_gem->prelim->SetMmapOffset(bo_gem->mem_region, mmap_arg);
1971 } else if (bufmgr_gem->has_lmem) {
1972 mmap_arg.flags = I915_MMAP_OFFSET_FIXED;
1973 } else {
1974 mmap_arg.flags = I915_MMAP_OFFSET_WB;
1975 }
1976 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
1977 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_MMAP_OFFSET,
1978 &mmap_arg);
1979 if (ret != 0) {
1980 ret = -errno;
1981 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error mapping buffer %d (%s): %s .\n",
1982 __FILE__, __LINE__, bo_gem->gem_handle,
1983 bo_gem->name, strerror(errno));
1984 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
1985 return ret;
1986 }
1987
1988 /* and mmap it */
1989 bo_gem->mem_virtual = drm_mmap(0, bo->size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE,
1990 MAP_SHARED, bufmgr_gem->fd,
1991 mmap_arg.offset);
1992 if (bo_gem->mem_virtual == MAP_FAILED) {
1993 bo_gem->mem_virtual = nullptr;
1994 ret = -errno;
1995 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error mapping buffer %d (%s): %s .\n",
1996 __FILE__, __LINE__,
1997 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name,
1998 strerror(errno));
1999 }
2000 }
2001
2002 assert(bufmgr_gem->has_wait_timeout);
2003 memclear(wait);
2004 wait.bo_handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2005 wait.timeout_ns = -1; // infinite wait
2006 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT, &wait);
2007 if (ret == -1) {
2008 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT failed (%d)\n",
2009 __FILE__, __LINE__, errno);
2010 }
2011 } else {
2012 struct drm_i915_gem_set_domain set_domain;
2013
2014 if (!bo_gem->mem_virtual) {
2015 struct drm_i915_gem_mmap mmap_arg;
2016
2017 MOS_DBG("bo_map: %d (%s), map_count=%d\n",
2018 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name, bo_gem->map_count);
2019
2020 memclear(mmap_arg);
2021 mmap_arg.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2022 mmap_arg.size = bo->size;
2023 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
2024 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_MMAP,
2025 &mmap_arg);
2026 if (ret != 0) {
2027 ret = -errno;
2028 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error mapping buffer %d (%s): %s .\n",
2029 __FILE__, __LINE__, bo_gem->gem_handle,
2030 bo_gem->name, strerror(errno));
2031 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2032 return ret;
2033 }
2034 VG(VALGRIND_MALLOCLIKE_BLOCK(mmap_arg.addr_ptr, mmap_arg.size, 0, 1));
2035 bo_gem->mem_virtual = (void *)(uintptr_t) mmap_arg.addr_ptr;
2036 }
2037
2038 memclear(set_domain);
2039 set_domain.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2040 set_domain.read_domains = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_CPU;
2041 if (write_enable)
2042 set_domain.write_domain = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_CPU;
2043 else
2044 set_domain.write_domain = 0;
2045 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
2046 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_SET_DOMAIN,
2047 &set_domain);
2048 if (ret != 0) {
2049 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error setting to CPU domain %d: %s\n",
2050 __FILE__, __LINE__, bo_gem->gem_handle,
2051 strerror(errno));
2052 }
2053 }
2054 MOS_DBG("bo_map: %d (%s) -> %p\n", bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name,
2055 bo_gem->mem_virtual);
2056#ifdef __cplusplus
2057 bo->virt = bo_gem->mem_virtual;
2058#else
2059 bo->virtual = bo_gem->mem_virtual;
2060#endif
2061
2062 if (write_enable)
2063 bo_gem->mapped_cpu_write = true;
2064
2065 mos_gem_bo_mark_mmaps_incoherent(bo);
2066 VG(VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_DEFINED(bo_gem->mem_virtual, bo->size));
2067 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2068
2069 return 0;
2070}
2071
2072drm_export int
2073map_gtt(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2074{
2075 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2076 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2077 int ret;
2078
2079 if (bo_gem->is_userptr)
2080 return -EINVAL;
2081
2082 /* Get a mapping of the buffer if we haven't before. */
2083 if (bo_gem->gtt_virtual == nullptr) {
2084 __u64 offset = 0;
2085 if (bufmgr_gem->has_lmem) {
2086 struct drm_i915_gem_mmap_offset mmap_arg;
2087
2088 MOS_DBG("map_gtt: mmap_offset %d (%s), map_count=%d\n",
2089 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name, bo_gem->map_count);
2090
2091 memclear(mmap_arg);
2092 mmap_arg.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2093 if (BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported()) {
2094 bufmgr_gem->prelim->SetMmapOffset(bo_gem->mem_region, mmap_arg);
2095 } else {
2096 mmap_arg.flags = I915_MMAP_OFFSET_FIXED;
2097 }
2098
2099 /* Get the fake offset back... */
2100 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
2101 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_MMAP_OFFSET,
2102 &mmap_arg);
2103 offset = mmap_arg.offset;
2104 }
2105 else
2106 {
2107 struct drm_i915_gem_mmap_gtt mmap_arg;
2108
2109 MOS_DBG("bo_map_gtt: mmap %d (%s), map_count=%d\n",
2110 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name, bo_gem->map_count);
2111
2112 memclear(mmap_arg);
2113 mmap_arg.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2114
2115 /* Get the fake offset back... */
2116 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
2117 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_MMAP_GTT,
2118 &mmap_arg);
2119 offset = mmap_arg.offset;
2120 }
2121 if (ret != 0) {
2122 ret = -errno;
2123 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error preparing buffer map %d (%s): %s .\n",
2124 __FILE__, __LINE__,
2125 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name,
2126 strerror(errno));
2127 return ret;
2128 }
2129
2130 /* and mmap it */
2131 bo_gem->gtt_virtual = drm_mmap(0, bo->size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE,
2132 MAP_SHARED, bufmgr_gem->fd,
2133 offset);
2134 if (bo_gem->gtt_virtual == MAP_FAILED) {
2135 bo_gem->gtt_virtual = nullptr;
2136 ret = -errno;
2137 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error mapping buffer %d (%s): %s .\n",
2138 __FILE__, __LINE__,
2139 bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name,
2140 strerror(errno));
2141 return ret;
2142 }
2143 }
2144#ifdef __cplusplus
2145 bo->virt = bo_gem->gtt_virtual;
2146#else
2147 bo->virtual = bo_gem->gtt_virtual;
2148#endif
2149
2150 MOS_DBG("bo_map_gtt: %d (%s) -> %p\n", bo_gem->gem_handle, bo_gem->name,
2151 bo_gem->gtt_virtual);
2152
2153 return 0;
2154}
2155
2156static int
2157mos_gem_bo_map_gtt(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2158{
2159 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2160 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2161 struct drm_i915_gem_set_domain set_domain;
2162 struct drm_i915_gem_wait wait;
2163 int ret;
2164
2165 pthread_mutex_lock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2166
2167 ret = map_gtt(bo);
2168 if (ret) {
2169 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2170 return ret;
2171 }
2172
2173 if (bufmgr_gem->has_lmem) {
2174 assert(bufmgr_gem->has_wait_timeout);
2175 memclear(wait);
2176 wait.bo_handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2177 wait.timeout_ns = -1; // infinite wait
2178 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT, &wait);
2179 if (ret == -1) {
2180 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT failed (%d)\n",
2181 __FILE__, __LINE__, errno);
2182 }
2183 } else {
2184 /* Now move it to the GTT domain so that the GPU and CPU
2185 * caches are flushed and the GPU isn't actively using the
2186 * buffer.
2187 *
2188 * The pagefault handler does this domain change for us when
2189 * it has unbound the BO from the GTT, but it's up to us to
2190 * tell it when we're about to use things if we had done
2191 * rendering and it still happens to be bound to the GTT.
2192 */
2193 memclear(set_domain);
2194 set_domain.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2195 set_domain.read_domains = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT;
2196 set_domain.write_domain = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT;
2197 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
2198 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_SET_DOMAIN,
2199 &set_domain);
2200 if (ret != 0) {
2201 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error setting domain %d: %s\n",
2202 __FILE__, __LINE__, bo_gem->gem_handle,
2203 strerror(errno));
2204 }
2205 }
2206 mos_gem_bo_mark_mmaps_incoherent(bo);
2207 VG(VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_DEFINED(bo_gem->gtt_virtual, bo->size));
2208 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2209
2210 return 0;
2211}
2212
2227static int
2228mos_gem_bo_map_unsynchronized(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2229{
2230 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2231#ifdef HAVE_VALGRIND
2232 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2233#endif
2234 int ret;
2235
2236 /* If the CPU cache isn't coherent with the GTT, then use a
2237 * regular synchronized mapping. The problem is that we don't
2238 * track where the buffer was last used on the CPU side in
2239 * terms of drm_intel_bo_map vs drm_intel_gem_bo_map_gtt, so
2240 * we would potentially corrupt the buffer even when the user
2241 * does reasonable things.
2242 */
2243 if (!bufmgr_gem->has_llc)
2244 return mos_gem_bo_map_gtt(bo);
2245
2246 pthread_mutex_lock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2247
2248 ret = map_gtt(bo);
2249 if (ret == 0) {
2250 mos_gem_bo_mark_mmaps_incoherent(bo);
2251 VG(VALGRIND_MAKE_MEM_DEFINED(bo_gem->gtt_virtual, bo->size));
2252 }
2253
2254 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2255
2256 return ret;
2257}
2258
2259static int mos_gem_bo_unmap(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2260{
2261 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem;
2262 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2263 int ret = 0;
2264
2265 if (bo == nullptr)
2266 return 0;
2267
2268 if (bo_gem->is_userptr)
2269 return 0;
2270
2271 bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2272
2273 pthread_mutex_lock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2274
2275 if (bo_gem->map_count <= 0) {
2276 MOS_DBG("attempted to unmap an unmapped bo\n");
2277 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2278 /* Preserve the old behaviour of just treating this as a
2279 * no-op rather than reporting the error.
2280 */
2281 return 0;
2282 }
2283
2284 if (bo_gem->mapped_cpu_write) {
2285 struct drm_i915_gem_sw_finish sw_finish;
2286
2287 /* Cause a flush to happen if the buffer's pinned for
2288 * scanout, so the results show up in a timely manner.
2289 * Unlike GTT set domains, this only does work if the
2290 * buffer should be scanout-related.
2291 */
2292 memclear(sw_finish);
2293 sw_finish.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2294 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
2295 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_SW_FINISH,
2296 &sw_finish);
2297 ret = ret == -1 ? -errno : 0;
2298
2299 bo_gem->mapped_cpu_write = false;
2300 }
2301
2302 /* We need to unmap after every innovation as we cannot track
2303 * an open vma for every bo as that will exhaasut the system
2304 * limits and cause later failures.
2305 */
2306 if (--bo_gem->map_count == 0) {
2307 mos_gem_bo_mark_mmaps_incoherent(bo);
2308#ifdef __cplusplus
2309 bo->virt = nullptr;
2310#else
2311 bo->virtual = nullptr;
2312#endif
2313 }
2314 pthread_mutex_unlock(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2315
2316 return ret;
2317}
2318
2319static int
2320mos_gem_bo_unmap_wc(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2321{
2322 return mos_gem_bo_unmap(bo);
2323}
2324
2325static int
2326mos_gem_bo_unmap_gtt(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2327{
2328 return mos_gem_bo_unmap(bo);
2329}
2330
2332static void
2333mos_gem_bo_wait_rendering(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2334{
2335 mos_gem_bo_start_gtt_access(bo, 1);
2336}
2337
2365drm_export int
2366mos_gem_bo_wait(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, int64_t timeout_ns)
2367{
2368
2369 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2370 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2371 struct drm_i915_gem_wait wait;
2372 int ret;
2373
2374 if (!bufmgr_gem->has_wait_timeout) {
2375 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Timed wait is not supported. Falling back to "
2376 "infinite wait\n", __FILE__, __LINE__);
2377 if (timeout_ns) {
2378 mos_gem_bo_wait_rendering(bo);
2379 return 0;
2380 } else {
2381 return mos_gem_bo_busy(bo) ? -ETIME : 0;
2382 }
2383 }
2384
2385 memclear(wait);
2386 wait.bo_handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2387 wait.timeout_ns = timeout_ns;
2388 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT, &wait);
2389 if (ret == -1)
2390 return -errno;
2391
2392 return ret;
2393}
2394
2402static void
2403mos_gem_bo_start_gtt_access(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, int write_enable)
2404{
2405 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2406 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2407 struct drm_i915_gem_set_domain set_domain;
2408 struct drm_i915_gem_wait wait;
2409 int ret;
2410
2411 if (bufmgr_gem->has_lmem) {
2412 assert(bufmgr_gem->has_wait_timeout);
2413 memclear(wait);
2414 wait.bo_handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2415 wait.timeout_ns = -1; // infinite wait
2416 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT, &wait);
2417 if (ret == -1) {
2418 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_WAIT failed (%d)\n",
2419 __FILE__, __LINE__, errno);
2420 }
2421 } else {
2422 memclear(set_domain);
2423 set_domain.handle = bo_gem->gem_handle;
2424 set_domain.read_domains = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT;
2425 set_domain.write_domain = write_enable ? I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT : 0;
2426 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd,
2427 DRM_IOCTL_I915_GEM_SET_DOMAIN,
2428 &set_domain);
2429 if (ret != 0) {
2430 MOS_DBG("%s:%d: Error setting memory domains %d (%08x %08x): %s .\n",
2431 __FILE__, __LINE__, bo_gem->gem_handle,
2432 set_domain.read_domains, set_domain.write_domain,
2433 strerror(errno));
2434 }
2435 }
2436}
2437
2438static void
2439mos_bufmgr_gem_destroy(struct mos_bufmgr *bufmgr)
2440{
2441 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bufmgr;
2442 struct drm_gem_close close_bo;
2443 int i, ret;
2444
2445 free(bufmgr_gem->exec2_objects);
2446 free(bufmgr_gem->exec_objects);
2447 free(bufmgr_gem->exec_bos);
2448 pthread_mutex_destroy(&bufmgr_gem->lock);
2449
2450 /* Free any cached buffer objects we were going to reuse */
2451 for (i = 0; i < bufmgr_gem->num_buckets; i++) {
2452 struct mos_gem_bo_bucket *bucket =
2453 &bufmgr_gem->cache_bucket[i];
2454 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem;
2455
2456 while (!DRMLISTEMPTY(&bucket->head)) {
2457 bo_gem = DRMLISTENTRY(struct mos_bo_gem,
2458 bucket->head.next, head);
2459 DRMLISTDEL(&bo_gem->head);
2460
2461 mos_gem_bo_free(&bo_gem->bo);
2462 }
2463 }
2464
2465 /* Release userptr bo kept hanging around for optimisation. */
2466 if (bufmgr_gem->userptr_active.ptr) {
2467 memclear(close_bo);
2468 close_bo.handle = bufmgr_gem->userptr_active.handle;
2469 ret = drmIoctl(bufmgr_gem->fd, DRM_IOCTL_GEM_CLOSE, &close_bo);
2470 free(bufmgr_gem->userptr_active.ptr);
2471 if (ret)
2472 fprintf(stderr,
2473 "Failed to release test userptr object! (%d) "
2474 "i915 kernel driver may not be sane!\n", errno);
2475 }
2476
2477 mos_vma_heap_finish(&bufmgr_gem->vma_heap[MEMZONE_SYS]);
2478 mos_vma_heap_finish(&bufmgr_gem->vma_heap[MEMZONE_DEVICE]);
2479 if (BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported()) {
2480 bufmgr_gem->prelim->UninitVmaHeap(&bufmgr_gem->vma_heap[MEMZONE_PRIME]);
2481
2482 BufmgrPrelim::DestroyPrelim(bufmgr_gem->prelim);
2483 bufmgr_gem->prelim = nullptr;
2484 }
2485
2486 if (bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_fd != -1)
2487 {
2488 close(bufmgr_gem->mem_profiler_fd);
2489 }
2490
2491 free(bufmgr);
2492}
2493
2494static int
2495do_bo_emit_reloc(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, uint32_t offset,
2496 struct mos_linux_bo *target_bo, uint32_t target_offset,
2497 uint32_t read_domains, uint32_t write_domain,
2498 bool need_fence, uint64_t presumed_offset)
2499{
2500 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2501 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2502 struct mos_bo_gem *target_bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) target_bo;
2503
2504 if (bo_gem->has_error)
2505 return -ENOMEM;
2506
2507 if (target_bo_gem->has_error) {
2508 bo_gem->has_error = true;
2509 return -ENOMEM;
2510 }
2511
2512 /* Create a new relocation list if needed */
2513 if (bo_gem->relocs == nullptr && mos_setup_reloc_list(bo))
2514 return -ENOMEM;
2515
2516 /* Check overflow */
2517 assert(bo_gem->reloc_count < bufmgr_gem->max_relocs);
2518
2519 /* Check args */
2520 assert(offset <= bo->size - 4);
2521 assert((write_domain & (write_domain - 1)) == 0);
2522
2523 /* An object needing a fence is a tiled buffer, so it won't have
2524 * relocs to other buffers.
2525 */
2526 if (need_fence) {
2527 assert(target_bo_gem->reloc_count == 0);
2528 target_bo_gem->reloc_tree_fences = 1;
2529 }
2530
2531 /* Make sure that we're not adding a reloc to something whose size has
2532 * already been accounted for.
2533 */
2534 assert(!bo_gem->used_as_reloc_target);
2535 if (target_bo_gem != bo_gem) {
2536 target_bo_gem->used_as_reloc_target = true;
2537 bo_gem->reloc_tree_size += target_bo_gem->reloc_tree_size;
2538 bo_gem->reloc_tree_fences += target_bo_gem->reloc_tree_fences;
2539 }
2540
2541 int flags = 0;
2542 if (target_bo_gem->pad_to_size)
2543 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_PAD_TO_SIZE;
2544 if (target_bo_gem->use_48b_address_range)
2545 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_SUPPORTS_48B_ADDRESS;
2546 if (target_bo_gem->exec_async)
2547 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_ASYNC;
2548 if (target_bo_gem->exec_capture)
2549 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_CAPTURE;
2550
2551 if (target_bo != bo)
2552 mos_gem_bo_reference(target_bo);
2553
2554 bo_gem->reloc_target_info[bo_gem->reloc_count].bo = target_bo;
2555 bo_gem->reloc_target_info[bo_gem->reloc_count].flags = flags;
2556 bo_gem->relocs[bo_gem->reloc_count].offset = offset;
2557 bo_gem->relocs[bo_gem->reloc_count].delta = target_offset;
2558 bo_gem->relocs[bo_gem->reloc_count].target_handle =
2559 target_bo_gem->gem_handle;
2560 bo_gem->relocs[bo_gem->reloc_count].read_domains = read_domains;
2561 if (BufmgrPrelim::IsPrelimSupported()) {
2562 // if reloc handle is batch buffer itself, cannot set write domain
2563 bo_gem->relocs[bo_gem->reloc_count].write_domain = (bo_gem->bo.handle == target_bo_gem->gem_handle ? 0 : write_domain);
2564 } else {
2565 bo_gem->relocs[bo_gem->reloc_count].write_domain = write_domain;
2566 }
2567 bo_gem->relocs[bo_gem->reloc_count].presumed_offset = presumed_offset;
2568 bo_gem->reloc_count++;
2569
2570 return 0;
2571}
2572
2573static void
2574mos_gem_bo_use_48b_address_range(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, uint32_t enable)
2575{
2576 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2577 bo_gem->use_48b_address_range = enable;
2578}
2579
2580static void
2581mos_gem_bo_set_object_async(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2582{
2583 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)bo;
2584 bo_gem->exec_async = true;
2585}
2586
2587static void
2588mos_gem_bo_set_exec_object_async(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, struct mos_linux_bo *target_bo)
2589{
2590 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2591 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2592 struct mos_bo_gem *target_bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) target_bo;
2593 int i;
2594 for (i = 0; i < bo_gem->reloc_count; i++)
2595 {
2596 if (bo_gem->reloc_target_info[i].bo == target_bo)
2597 {
2598 bo_gem->reloc_target_info[i].flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_ASYNC;
2599 break;
2600 }
2601 }
2602
2603 for (i = 0; i < bo_gem->softpin_target_count; i++)
2604 {
2605 if (bo_gem->softpin_target[i].bo == target_bo)
2606 {
2607 bo_gem->softpin_target[i].flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_ASYNC;
2608 break;
2609 }
2610 }
2611}

2613static void
2614mos_gem_bo_set_object_capture(struct mos_linux_bo *bo)
2615{
2616 // Do nothing if bo is nullptr
2617 if (bo == nullptr)
2618 {
2619 return;
2620 }
2621 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2622 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)bo;
2623 if (bufmgr_gem != nullptr &&
2624 bo_gem != nullptr &&
2625 !bufmgr_gem->object_capture_disabled)
2626 {
2627 bo_gem->exec_capture = true;
2628 }
2629}
2630
2631static int
2632mos_gem_bo_add_softpin_target(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, struct mos_linux_bo *target_bo, bool write_flag)
2633{
2634 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2635 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2636 struct mos_bo_gem *target_bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) target_bo;
2637 if (bo_gem->has_error)
2638 return -ENOMEM;
2639
2640 if (target_bo_gem->has_error) {
2641 bo_gem->has_error = true;
2642 return -ENOMEM;
2643 }
2644
2645 if (!target_bo_gem->is_softpin)
2646 return -EINVAL;
2647 if (target_bo_gem == bo_gem)
2648 return -EINVAL;
2649
2650 if (bo_gem->softpin_target_count == bo_gem->max_softpin_target_count) {
2651 int max_softpin_target_count = bo_gem->max_softpin_target_count * 2;
2652
2653 /* initial softpin target count*/
2654 if (max_softpin_target_count == 0){
2655 max_softpin_target_count = INITIAL_SOFTPIN_TARGET_COUNT;
2656 }
2657
2658 bo_gem->softpin_target = (struct mos_softpin_target *)realloc(bo_gem->softpin_target, max_softpin_target_count *
2659 sizeof(struct mos_softpin_target));
2660 if (!bo_gem->softpin_target)
2661 return -ENOMEM;
2662
2663 bo_gem->max_softpin_target_count = max_softpin_target_count;
2664 }
2665
2666 int flags = EXEC_OBJECT_PINNED;
2667 if (target_bo_gem->pad_to_size)
2668 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_PAD_TO_SIZE;
2669 if (target_bo_gem->use_48b_address_range)
2670 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_SUPPORTS_48B_ADDRESS;
2671 if (target_bo_gem->exec_async)
2672 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_ASYNC;
2673 if (target_bo_gem->exec_capture)
2674 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_CAPTURE;
2675 if (write_flag)
2676 flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_WRITE;
2677
2678 bo_gem->softpin_target[bo_gem->softpin_target_count].bo = target_bo;
2679 bo_gem->softpin_target[bo_gem->softpin_target_count].flags = flags;
2680 mos_gem_bo_reference(target_bo);
2681 bo_gem->softpin_target_count++;
2682
2683 return 0;
2684}
2685
2686static mos_oca_exec_list_info*
2687mos_bufmgr_bo_get_softpin_targets_info(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, int *count)
2688{
2689 if(bo == nullptr || count == nullptr)
2690 {
2691 return nullptr;
2692 }
2693 mos_oca_exec_list_info *info = nullptr;
2694 std::vector<int> bo_added;
2695 int counter = 0;
2696 int MAX_COUNT = 50;
2697 struct mos_bufmgr_gem *bufmgr_gem = (struct mos_bufmgr_gem *) bo->bufmgr;
2698 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)bo;
2699 int softpin_target_count = bo_gem->softpin_target_count;
2700 if(softpin_target_count == 0 || softpin_target_count > MAX_COUNT)
2701 {
2702 return info;
2703 }
2704 info = (mos_oca_exec_list_info *)malloc((softpin_target_count + 1) * sizeof(mos_oca_exec_list_info));
2705 if(info == nullptr)
2706 {
2707 return info;
2708 }
2709
2710 for(int i = 0; i < softpin_target_count; i++)
2711 {
2712 /*note: set capture for each bo*/
2713 struct mos_softpin_target *target = (struct mos_softpin_target *)&bo_gem->softpin_target[i];
2714 struct mos_bo_gem *target_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *)target->bo;
2715 if(std::find(bo_added.begin(), bo_added.end(), target->bo->handle) == bo_added.end())
2716 {
2717 info[counter].handle = target->bo->handle;
2718 info[counter].size = target->bo->size;
2719 info[counter].offset64 = target->bo->offset64;
2720
2721 if (!bufmgr_gem->object_capture_disabled)
2722 target->flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_CAPTURE;
2723
2724 info[counter].flags = target->flags;
2725 info[counter].mem_region = target_gem->mem_region;
2726 info[counter].is_batch = false;
2727 bo_added.push_back(target->bo->handle);
2728 counter++;
2729 }
2730 }
2731
2732 /*note: bo is cmd bo, also need to be added*/
2733 int bb_flags = 0;
2734 if (bo_gem->pad_to_size)
2735 bb_flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_PAD_TO_SIZE;
2736 if (bo_gem->use_48b_address_range)
2737 bb_flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_SUPPORTS_48B_ADDRESS;
2738 if (bo_gem->is_softpin)
2739 bb_flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_PINNED;
2740 if (bo_gem->exec_async)
2741 bb_flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_ASYNC;
2742 if (bo_gem->exec_capture)
2743 bb_flags |= EXEC_OBJECT_CAPTURE;
2744
2745 info[counter].handle = bo->handle;
2746 info[counter].size = bo->size;
2747 info[counter].offset64 = bo->offset64;
2748 info[counter].flags = bb_flags;
2749 info[counter].mem_region = bo_gem->mem_region;
2750 info[counter].is_batch = true;
2751 counter++;
2752
2753 *count = counter;
2754
2755 return info;
2756}
2757
2758static int
2759mos_gem_bo_pad_to_size(struct mos_linux_bo *bo, uint64_t pad_to_size)
2760{
2761 struct mos_bo_gem *bo_gem = (struct mos_bo_gem *) bo;
2762
2763 if (pad_to_size && pad_to_size < bo->size)
2764 return -EINVAL;
2765
2766 bo_gem->pad_to_size = pad_to_size;
2767 return 0;
2768}
